response.original_title: Slow and mournfully; slow and sad; slow and solemnly
response.overview: "In a single performance of a piece of music split into two parts, the pianist plays through Eric Satieâ€™s Gymnopedies (no. 1 - 3) three times consecutively, first using only one hand, and then the other, with the resulting recordings combined afterwards. Although the pianist initially keeps her timing, eventually the impossibility of splitting her performance takes its toll; the music becomes mistimed, occasionally to the point of discordant plinking." - Artist Statement
